conclusion: To determine the final positions of the toy cars A and B after they collide, we need to consider the principles of physics, specifically the conservation of momentum and the effects of collisions.
Car A is located on the left side of the image.
Car B is located on the right side of the image.
Both cars are moving towards each other.
The initial velocities of both cars can be assumed to be equal in magnitude but opposite in direction (since they are moving towards each other).
When two objects collide, the total momentum before the collision is equal to the total momentum after the collision.
Since the cars are identical in mass and moving towards each other with the same speed, the collision will result in an elastic collision if there is no external force acting on them.
